title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel-group, Multicenter Study With a Long-Term Extension Treatment Period to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of JNJ-63733657, an Anti-tau Monoclonal Antibody, in Participants With Early Alzheimer's Disease
description_brief: The primary purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of JNJ-63733657 versus placebo on clinical decline as measured by the Integrated Alzheimer's Disease Rating Scale (iADRS), a composite of cognition and function.
drug: JNJ-63733657 (posdinemab) — humanized IgG1/kappa anti-phospho-tau monoclonal antibody
explanation_target: Reason: The trial tests JNJ-63733657 which is explicitly described as an anti-tau monoclonal antibody and uses the iADRS (a clinical composite of cognition and function) to evaluate slowing of clinical decline — indicating a disease-modifying intent rather than a symptomatic cognitive enhancer or neuropsychiatric treatment. citeturn0search4turn0search2

Act: Key extracted details — drug name JNJ-63733657 (posdinemab) and molecular class: a humanized monoclonal antibody binding phosphorylated tau (pT217). Phase 1 data showed dose-dependent reductions in CSF p217+tau, supporting that the agent targets tau pathology. The trial title and purpose explicitly state "Anti-tau Monoclonal Antibody" and the primary endpoint is iADRS (clinical decline). citeturn0search0turn0search4turn0search2

Reflect: Classification check — this matches the definition of 'Disease-targeted biologic' (a biologic targeting Alzheimer’s pathology such as tau). It is not a small molecule, nor described as a purely symptomatic cognitive enhancer or an intervention for neuropsychiatric symptoms. No substantive ambiguity in the provided description. citeturn0search0turn0search2

explanation_agent: Reason: The investigational agent JNJ-63733657 (posdinemab) is explicitly described as a humanized monoclonal antibody that binds phosphorylated tau (pT217) in the proline-rich domain, i.e., it targets tau pathology rather than amyloid or symptomatic neurotransmitter systems. citeturn0search0turn0search4

Act: Extracted details from the trial description and publications — drug name: JNJ-63733657 (posdinemab); molecular class: humanized IgG1/kappa anti-phospho-tau monoclonal antibody; epitope: pT217; phase 1 data showed dose-dependent reductions in CSF p217+tau and preclinical reduction in tau seeding. The pivotal study (NCT04619420) is an anti-tau monoclonal antibody trial with the clinical endpoint iADRS, confirming a disease-modifying, tau-directed approach. citeturn0search4turn0search0turn0search1turn0search2
